author: TEDx Talks
description:
Why do we buy things we don’t even need? In this TEDx talk, sales expert and former research scientist David Priemer pulls back the curtain on a powerful storytelling framework; born from the world of infomercials and reveals his P.I.T.C.H. formula for crafting irresistible offers. Whether you’re selling a product, leading a team, or just trying to win a friendly debate, you’ll learn science and empathy-based tactics to communicate, motivate, and persuade. 

David Priemer started his career as an award-winning research scientist before spending two decades leading top-performing technology sales teams. Today, as the Founder of Cerebral Selling, David's unique science and empathy-based sales strategies have been published in the Harvard Business Review as well as Forbes, Entrepreneur, and Inc. magazines. He is the author of two bestselling sales books available in 6 languages, and in his TEDx talk, David will help you supercharge your persuasive power by revealing the secret storytelli
title: Why you're bad at buying stuff | David Priemer | TEDxJeffersonU
